title: Eastenders star Zack Morris shaken after vile racist attack in car park
text:

Eastenders' Zack Morris has been left shaken and upset after suffering a vile racist attack in a car park.

The actor, who plays Keegan Baker in the soap, told how the random man spat abuse at him, including the n-word.

The horror comes days after England’s footballers were taunted with racist chants throughout their match in Bulgaria.

In the late night attack on Friday, he was also called Uncle Tom – a derogatory term for a lower-class person based on race.

Zack, 21, said yesterday: “Last night I was walking through a car park to my car and was getting abuse from this random guy calling me a ‘N*****’ and ‘Uncle Tom’ repeatedly.

(Image: BBC/Kieron McCarron)

(Image: Zack Morris/Twitter)

“This is the sort of mentality that is still destroying our generation and it must stop.”

Sources close to Zack, who helped EastEnders to a best soap Bafta in May, said he was left “very upset” and shaken by the attack.

The actor’s soap pals rallied around him last night.

Co-star Shona McGarty, who plays Whitney Dean, called the incident “disgraceful”.

On-screen mum Lorraine Stanley, Karen Taylor in the show, vented her shock and anger online, writing: “Shame on him!!! Love you son, wish I was there.”

(Image: BBC / Kieron McCarron)

One of the soap’s writers, Daran Little, added: “Oh man... hanging head and sending love.”

Fans showed support on Twitter , with one writing: ­“Disrespectful, I don’t get why people are racist and think it makes them the big man, it doesn’t and people shouldn’t get judged by the colour of there skin.”

Essex-born Zack joined the show in 2017 as Keegan alongside the rest of the Baker family. He has featured in many major storylines, including a hard-hitting knife crime plot.
